body_html:
@alexbw r1.10 doesn't seem to support list appending and tf.stack. However, I found it work on r1.11 (compiled from source).

I think I could share the code here, I simplify the code a bit:

@autograph.convert()
def chunkify(tensor, max_chunk_size):
    Agrs:
        tensor: the tensor to be chunked
        max_chunk_size: maximum size of a chunk
    """
    s = tf.shape(tensor)
    i = 0
    out = []
    autograph.set_element_type(out, tensor.dtype)

    while i < s[0]:
        # cut a new tensor
        t = tensor[i:i+max_chunk_size]

        ...

        out.append(t)
        i += max_chunk_size

    out = tf.stack(out)

    return out

body:
@alexbw r1.10 doesn't seem to support list appending and `tf.stack`. However, I found it work on r1.11 (compiled from source).

I think I could share the code here, I simplify the code a bit:

```
@autograph.convert()
def chunkify(tensor, max_chunk_size):
    Agrs:
        tensor: the tensor to be chunked
        max_chunk_size: maximum size of a chunk
    """
    s = tf.shape(tensor)
    i = 0
    out = []
    autograph.set_element_type(out, tensor.dtype)

    while i < s[0]:
        # cut a new tensor
        t = tensor[i:i+max_chunk_size]

        ...

        out.append(t)
        i += max_chunk_size

    out = tf.stack(out)

    return out
```
